channel.title: Comments on: Getting Started with Neo4j 2.0

item.title: By: Ramesh
item.dc:creator: Ramesh
item.description:
This use case is well explained and its good for beginner to understand development in Neo4j..! Thanks for posting this kind of use case.
--Ramesh
item.content:encoded:
This use case is well explained and its good for beginner to understand development in Neo4j..!
Thanks for posting this kind of use case.

–Ramesh

item.title: By: jim
item.dc:creator: jim
item.description:
@Maarten
I can give my view of what would be useful. There's probably some overlap with that and what will ship with Neo4j in the 2.x series. Off the top of my head:
1. Property exists constraints. E.g. for a label :Person, there must be first_name and last_name properties present on that node. 2. Structural constraints. E.g. if a node has a label :Car then it must be connected via an incoming :DRIVES relationship to at least one other node with label :Person.
Hope that's useful.
Jim
item.content:encoded:
@Maarten

I can give my view of what would be useful. There’s probably some overlap with that and what will ship with Neo4j in the 2.x series. Off the top of my head:

1. Property exists constraints. E.g. for a label :Person, there must be first_name and last_name properties present on that node.
2. Structural constraints. E.g. if a node has a label :Car then it must be connected via an incoming :DRIVES relationship to at least one other node with label :Person.

Hope that’s useful.

Jim

item.title: By: Maarten
item.dc:creator: Maarten
item.description: You say that 'Future versions of Neo4j 2.x will build more useful constraints. For example, we could imagine ...'. Can you give more details about the actual planned constraints?
item.content:encoded: You say that ‘Future versions of Neo4j 2.x will build more useful constraints. For example, we could imagine …’. Can you give more details about the actual planned constraints?
